channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bushes and bramble have become overgrown behind my back fence which is adjoining to the school playground, 3rd December
item.description:
The bramble and bushes are between my rear boundary and the school/playground boundary Access to this area is via the school playground. I also believe there is a dead fox in this space amongst the weeds and bramble

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maybury Close, Petts Wood, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drive entrance not aligned with drop kerb, 3rd December
item.description:
The neighbour at no 56 Marion Crescent is using their neighbours at 58 's drop kerb to access their own ''make shift drive''. The 1st car in the photo is a Black Nissan 2013 plate registration(gaining unlawful access) and the car beside that is the actual ownners drop kerb and drive. No 56 Marion crescent enters the neighbours space to gain entry and access on to his drive, when the car doors are open this overlaps on to their neighbours driveway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Marion Crescent, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 3rd December
item.description:
Large pothole still in existence at the juction of Tudor way and Petts Wood Road. Despite this road being closed on Monday for pothole repairs, Why was this one not done at the same time? Its ridiculous and to think we are paying for all this. So when this gets fixed its going to be even more costs for getting traffic management in again etc etc etc. The waste of our money is staggering and then the council tell us how broke they are...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willett Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf litter very slippery, 3rd December
item.description:
Having waiting for weeks for this section to be cleared, nothing has happened. Someone will fall and injure themselves shortly, so dangerous and simply unacceptable. Council tax pays for nothing evidently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Hill, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Abandoned cones, 3rd December
item.description:
There are numerous traffic cones which have been left on the side of this slip road for at least the last year. They serve no purpose and have been left after road works. There are cones/frames on the road between Junct 2 and where it joins the roundabout with A225 Princes Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canterbury Way, Brooklands, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The bark chippings surrounding tree outside 57/59 Northumberland Avenue keep being spread across pavement, 3rd December
item.description:
Contractor are trying to address the upkeep, but animals seem to be scraping the bark chippings across the pavement. Neighbours are trying to tidy it. It's there an alternative to bark chippings that won't be spread everywhere.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northumberland Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
